text: School of Vocational Engineering Page 1 of 5 Document: Introductory Tutorial.docx Author: O.Gredeskoul Olga Gredeskoul Save Date: 10/02/2016 MANU2112 Engineering Science Introductory Tutorial Q1. Convert the following numbers to scientific notation: a) 568017 b) 0.000309 c) 37004 d) 103.250 Q2. Re-write the following expression using scientific notation, calculate, and express the result in both, Scientific and standard arithmetic notations 213.4 ∗ 0.003751 3600.0 ∗ 15.07 Q3. Calculate the following without using a calculator: 10−3∗ 10 12 10−9∗ √108 Q4. A car completes a journey of 350 km in 4 hours 22 ½ minutes. What is its average speed in km/h expressed in scientific notation? Q5. The radius of the Sun is 695 500 km. What is its approximate volume written in scientific notation? (Volume of a sphere is (4/3) π R 3 ) Q6. The surface area of a door is 11 000 cm2 . How many mm2 is that? Q7 (a) (b) (c) On an unknown planet a period of oscillation of a simple pendulum with length of 1.0 m is 4.0 s. What is the acceleration due to gravity g on this planet? School of Vocational Engineering Page 2 of 5 Document: Introductory Tutorial.docx Author: O.Gredeskoul Olga Gredeskoul Save Date: 10/02/2016 Q8. Solve for a variable in parentheses: 1. 2. Q9 Q10 2. School of Vocational Engineering Page 3 of 5 Document: Introductory Tutorial.docx Author: O.Gredeskoul Olga Gredeskoul Save Date: 10/02/2016 Q11. Use the quadratic formula 𝑖𝑓 𝑎𝑥2+ 𝑏𝑥 + 𝑐 = 0, 𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑛 𝑥1,2= −𝑏 ± √𝑏2− 4𝑎𝑐 2𝑎 to solve following quadratic equations: Q12. A cyclist travels in a straight line according to x(t) = ( -7 - 6t + t2 ) m, where t is in seconds. (a) At what time does the cyclist reach the origin (x = 0)? (b) What was her starting point (coordinate) at time = 0? (c) How long does it take for her to move from the origin x = 0 to the coordinate x = 10 m? (d) If the velocity of the cyclist changes as v(t) =( - 6 + 2t )m/s , what is her velocity at x = 10m? School of Vocational Engineering Page 4 of 5 Document: Introductory Tutorial.docx Author: O.Gredeskoul Olga Gredeskoul Save Date: 10/02/2016 Answers. 1. (1) Using uncertainties of direct measurements where 𝑡𝑎𝑣 = ∑ 𝑡𝑖𝑖 𝑁 , N = 10, ∆𝑡𝑖 = ∣ 𝑡𝑖 − 𝑡𝑎𝑣 ∣ , 𝑎𝑛𝑑 ∆𝑡𝑎𝑣 = ∑ ∆𝑡𝑖𝑖 𝑁 N t(s) Δt (s) 1 6.5 0.006 2 6.46 0.046 3 6.44 0.066 4 6.53 0.024 5 6.56 0.054 6 6.52 0.014 7 6.54 0.034 8 6.5 0.006 9 6.43 0.076 10 6.58 0.074 Average 6.506 0.04 School of Vocational Engineering Page 5 of 5 Document: Introductory Tutorial.docx Author: O.Gredeskoul Olga Gredeskoul Save Date: 10/02/2016 NOTE: Average uncertainty of the measurements (0.04s) is larger than the accuracy of the instrument (0.02 s). The result for time t is t = (6.51 ± 0.04)s (2) Using method to calculate uncertainties of indirect measurements we’ll find the relative uncertainty of the speed first: d = (1.50 ± 0.01) m , t = (6.51 ± 0.04) s 𝑣 = 𝑑 𝑡 , 𝑣𝑎𝑣 = 1.50 6.51 = 0.230 𝑚 𝑠 , Δ𝑣 𝑣𝑎𝑣 = Δd 𝑑𝑎𝑣 + Δt 𝑡𝑎𝑣 = 0.01 1.50 + 0.04 6.51 = 0.013 Δ𝑣 = 0.013 ∗ 0.230 = 0.003 𝑚 𝑠 Finally, 𝑣 = (0.230 ± 0.003) 𝑚 𝑠
